abstract: Riverstone Holdings, a private energy fund that is part of the politically connected Carlyle Group, agreed on Thursday to pay $30 million to resolve its role in a widening public pension fund pension fund inquiry by the New York State Attorney General Andrew Cuomo.

lead_paragraph: Update | 4:05 p.m. Riverstone Holdings, a private energy fund and business partner the Carlyle Group, agreed on Thursday to pay $30 million to resolve its role in a widening public pension fund inquiry by Andrew Cuomo, the New York attorney general, The New York Times’ Leslie Wayne reported.

headline.main: Riverstone to Settle Pension Fund Inquiry
